intro: Talauma venezuelensis, commonly known as the Venezuelan talauma, is a species of flowering plant native to South America, particularly Venezuela. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow and orange. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils near rivers or in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
